title: 89/466/EEC: Council Decision of 18 July 1989 authorizing the United Kingdom to apply a measure derogating from Article 11 (A) (1) (b) of the Sixth Directive 77/388/EEC on the harmonization of the laws of the Member States relating to turnover taxes
header:
COUNCIL DECISION of 18 July 1989 authorizing the United Kingdom to apply a measure derogating from Article 11 (A) (1) (b) of the Sixth Directive 77/388/EEC on the harmonization of the laws of the Member States relating to turnover taxes  (89/466/EEC)
THE COUNCIL OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body: By way of derogation from Article 11 (A) (1) (b) of the Sixth Directive, the United Kingdom is hereby authorized to use the open market value as the taxable amount for the supply, within the meaning of Article 5 (7) (a) and (b) of the said  Directive, of buildings or parts of buildings before first occupation and of the land on which they stand.
This authorization shall be granted pending the deletion of point 16 of Annex F to the Sixth Directive.
This Directive is addressed to the United Kingdom.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 18 July 1989.
For the Council
The President
R. DUMAS
(1) OJ No L 145, 13. 6. 1977, p. 1.
